description.narrative:
Poor women and men at risk of climate change hazards and disasters are informed and empowered to voice their concerns, needs and aspirations, as well as to make and negotiate appropriate decisions to protect their interests and livelihood. The project duration isfrom August 2013 to Mar 2016. Total approved budget of threes year is US$231,000.
Approach The project works to achieve three specific outcomes: - Poor women and men, particularly ethnic minorities, have enhanced awareness and confidence to shape, claim and receive required information and services to adapt their crop calendar and farming system to consequences of climate change. - Provincial department of agriculture and rural development (DARD) and hydro-met stations have strong capacity to collect and analyze biological and meteorological data for crop-weather simulation and the development of agro-climatic forecasts - A farmers #customized agro-climate forecast and information system (between national and grass root levels) is institutionalized and presented in relevant workshops, networks for dissemination and advocacy.
Target Groups Hai Phuc covers 3 villages: Ta Lang, Nam, and Van Van. It comprises 131 households (281 men and 291 women) . The large majority (94 households) belong to the Van Kieu ethnic group, while the others areKinh people. Hai thanh covers 3 villages: Trung Don, Phuoc Dien and Kim Sanh. It comprises 525 households (1088 men and 1135 women). The entire population are Kinh people.
Expected changes - 80%people in two communes aware the role of using agro-climate forecast bulletin in their cultivation - At least 70% communes in Dak Rong and Hai Lang district receive the bulletins with new template -Higher crop production and minimize the risk from disaster in the context of climate change - The good documentation on model implementation and circulate to relevant government agencies in Quang Tri province - Interest communes from other districts willing to buy the agro-climate forecast bulletin for their communes through the good impact evidences from piloted model

participating-org.narrative: Quang Tri Department of Agriculture and Rural Development (DARD) is a governmental agency performing state management functions in the fields of agriculture, forestry, salt production, fishery, irrigation/water services and rural development nationwide, includingstate management functions with regard to delivery of public service in accordance with legal documents. Guide, supervise and organize the implementation of legal documents, strategies, master plans, programs, projects, standards, techno-economic norms relating to agriculture, forestry, salt industry, fishery, irrigation/water services and rural development. Disseminate information and raise public awareness about regulations within areas covered by the Department#s mandated areas Perform governance responsibilities for crops and livestock breeds; cultivation, livestock breeds, harvest, storage techniques and make annual assessment reports on crops production and livestock breeds. Regulate management, production, trade and using fertilizers; test and approve new fertilizers; issuequality standards of fertilizers; issue national standards of fertilizers
